page.title: 04Local Housing
page.content: Perhaps the oldest house in the area is Bewsey Old Hall,a Tudor house,built on a site which has been occupied for at least 700 years. Also interesting is the Sankey Garden Suburb,an early example of town planning,based on the ideas of Sir Ebenezer Howard.A 20 acre site with room for 240 houses,with ample public gardens and open space was planned,but only four houses were built in Sankey. There is much inter and post war semi and detached housing. Recent years has seen the building of New Town housing in the Hood Manor and Old Hall areas.
